intro: Picridium vulgare var. cupanianum, commonly known as the common yellow rocket, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems and alternate, pinnately divided leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows.
